title: Effects of Kim depositing cash, CB buying bonds

content.description:
In answering the question, you should emphasize the line of reasoning that generated your results; it is not enough to list the results of your analysis. Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes.

Assume that the reserve requirement is 20 percent and banks hold no excess reserves. The banking system has limited reserves.

Assume that Kim deposits $100 of cash from her pocket into her checking account. Calculate each of the following. Show your work.

The maximum dollar amount the commercial bank can initially lend

The maximum total change in demand deposits in the banking system

The maximum change in the money supply

Assume that the central bank buys $5 million in government bonds on the open market. As a result of the open market purchase, calculate the maximum increase in the money supply in the banking system. Show your work.

Given the increase in the money supply in part (b), what happens to real wages in the short run? Explain.
